quote-text:
[Jack Longino has] just published two papers describing 33 new species of ants, bringing his personal ânew species" total to 131. Longino says thatâs actually average among entomologists. âI do OK,“ he says, noting that some scientists have discovered thousands. But naming the newly discovered bugs is where you can really have fun. Longino recalls his graduate student â a self-described âmetal head” â encouraging him to be creative.

ââJack, Jack, you oughta name these things, like, after demons,â" the student exhorted. âSo Zipacna was one of these Mayan lords of the underworld, and there was this word in the dictionary that was Mabuya, that was a demon, and so I named one Eurhopalothrix mabuya, which I think just sounds great.“
